perturbation.original_text:
This agreement (“Agreement”) is made by and between Erchonia Corporation. (“Erchonia”) whose address
is 650 Atlantis Rd., Melbourne, Florida, USA, 32904 and InnerScope Hearing Technologies Inc, (“Distributor”)
whose address is 2151 Professional Drive, Second Floor, Roseville, California, USA, 95661 hereafter referred to
collectively as the (“Parties”).
perturbation.changed_text:
This agreement (“Agreement”) is made by and between Erchonia Corporation. (“Erchonia”) whose address
is 650 Atlantis Rd., Melbourne, Florida, USA, 32904 and InnerScope Hearing Technologies Inc, (“Recipient”)
whose address is 2151 Professional Drive, Second Floor, Roseville, California, USA, 95661 hereafter referred to
collectively as the (“Parties”).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is a key term that defines the role of InnerScope Hearing Technologies Inc. Replacing it with 'Recipient' creates confusion about the actual role and responsibilities of InnerScope throughout the agreement. Is InnerScope a distributor or just a recipient of products?

perturbation.original_text:
Subject to the terms set forth in this agreement, Erchonia grants Distributor the exclusive, non-
transferable right and license to promote, distribute and sell the Products identified in Exhibit A to
those type of customer specified in Exhibit B and only within the Territory specified in Exhibit B.
Distributor shall only distribute or sell the Products to customers who are licensed health care
professionals and meet the other requirements set forth in Exhibit B.
perturbation.changed_text:
Subject to the terms set forth in this agreement, Erchonia grants Marketer the exclusive, non-
transferable right and license to promote, distribute and sell the Products identified in Exhibit A to
those type of customer specified in Exhibit B and only within the Territory specified in Exhibit B.
Distributor shall only distribute or sell the Products to customers who are licensed health care
professionals and meet the other requirements set forth in Exhibit B.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Marketer' in the first sentence of section 1a. This creates ambiguity in the agreement because InnerScope is later referred to as 'Distributor,' and both terms are now used. This inconsistency is problematic and introduces confusion by implying two separate roles.

perturbation.original_text:
Erchonia shall indemnify, defend and hold Distributor harmless from any claims, demands, liabilities
or expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by Distributor as a result of any claim or
proceeding against Distributor arising out of or based upon: (i) a claim that the Products infringe
upon any U.S. patent, trademark, copyright or other intellectual property rights of any third party, (ii)
the products fail to comply with applicable federal law or regulation.
perturbation.changed_text:
Erchonia shall indemnify, defend and hold InnerScope harmless from any claims, demands, liabilities
or expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by Distributor as a result of any claim or
proceeding against Distributor arising out of or based upon: (i) a claim that the Products infringe
upon any U.S. patent, trademark, copyright or other intellectual property rights of any third party, (ii)
the products fail to comply with applicable federal law or regulation.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Distributor' with 'InnerScope' in the first part of the sentence, while keeping 'Distributor' in the remainder of the sentence, leads to confusion. The sentence implies that Erchonia will protect InnerScope from liabilities of the Distributor. Given the agreement defines InnerScope as the Distributor, it could be unclear who is responsible for which actions. Also, it would be unclear who's liable for claims made.
